page.title: 10HISTORY OF OPEN HOUSES
page.content: HERE ARE FURTHER DETAILS OF HOUSES AND GARDENS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC AS MENTIONED IN THE PREVIOUS PAGE. DIBLEYS,SOUTH STREET:THE HOUSE AND FRONT AREA OF GROUND,INCLUDING WHERE AN OLD BARN WAS,WERE FREEHOLD PROPERTY BOUGHT IN 1738,PREVIOUS TO WHICH IT HAD BEEN OWNED BY A FAMILY WHO HAD PREVIOUSLY FARMED PARSONAGE. FORGE HOUSE,WESTBROOK STREET:THE PLOT OF LAND WAS FREEHOLD OF THE LORD OF THE MANOR.THE FORGE WAS A WOODEN BUILDING IN 1875.MEMBERS OF THE FAMILY LIVED IN AND LATER OWNED THE HOUSE NOW PARTLY CALLED THE FORGE.FORGE COTTAGE WAS REBUILT FROM THE OLD FORGE. GILMORE COTTAGE,SOUTH STREET:THE OWNER WAS A MALTSTER LIVING THERE ABOUT 1780 HALL BARN CLOSE,CHAPEL LANE:WAS BOUGHT IN 1747 BY A TAILOR AND ONE OF THE FOUR FOUNDERS OF THE BLEWBURY CLUB.HERE W. RUSHTON,THE ARTIST,HAD HIS STUDIO.
